meanings.definition: A defensive obstacle formed by felled trees with sharpened branches.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers hid behind the abattis to protect themselves.
meanings.sent2: The abattis blocked the path of the advancing army.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels thought the abattis was a fun playground.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like an abattis, sharp and impenetrable.
meanings.sent5: The abattis loomed menacingly in the forest, a formidable defense.

meanings.definition: A barricade of felled trees with branches facing outward.
meanings.sent1: We built an abattis to keep the wild animals out of the camp.
meanings.sent2: The abattis surrounded the perimeter of the fortress.
meanings.sent3: The birds perched on the abattis, enjoying the view.
meanings.sent4: His emotions were like an abattis, keeping others at a distance.
meanings.sent5: The abattis stood tall and proud, a natural barrier against intruders.

meanings.definition: A barrier made of felled trees with branches pointing in the direction of the enemy.
meanings.sent1: The abattis was strategically placed to impede the enemy's progress.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers quickly constructed an abattis to defend their position.
meanings.sent3: The rabbits tried to hop over the abattis but failed comically.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like an abattis, blocking out any doubts.
meanings.sent5: The abattis stretched across the battlefield, a formidable challenge for the opposing forces.
